items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: Derwent Water Lake level has started to rise due to heavy rain this morning. Flooding is likely to affect low-lying land in locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwentwater.  Derwent Water Lake is forecast to peak around 8pm this evening (09/11/2021).  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near these watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. We continue to monitor the situation and this message will be updated tomorrow, Wednesday 10/11/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: This flood alert has been removed as the period of concern has passed. We are continuing to monitor tidal conditions and will re-issue if necessary for subsequent tides.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: Strong winds and spring tides may cause large waves and spray overtopping along the East Yorkshire Coast and the eastern part of the Humber Estuary today, Tuesday 9th November between 09:00-10:45. The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around Kilnsea and Spurn Point. Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated by 9PM on Tuesday 9th November 2021, or as the situation changes.
